info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 13 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Hamilton and east central Franklin Counties through 830 PM CDT... At 800 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles northeast of Thompsonville, or 9 miles southwest of Mcleansboro, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southern Hamilton and east central Franklin Counties, including the following locations... Macedonia. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
